message.content:
cs.IT, cs.SP, cs.NA, cs.SI, cs.LG. 

The paper deals with the problem of phase retrieval, which is a common topic in information theory (cs.IT) and signal processing (cs.SP). The use of structured convolutions and the sampling of both $f$ and $f^{\prime}$ on the real line suggest a numerical analysis (cs.NA) perspective. The experimental results with the Gerchberg-Saxton method suggest a machine learning (cs.LG) perspective. Finally, the comparison between conjugate phase retrieval and phase retrieval suggests a signal processing (cs.SP) or information theory (cs.IT) perspective.
